venue.name: Cambridge Public Library - Central Square Branch

item.description:
20 curious people signed up so far between the 3 "going" groups.

This is co- posted to Boston Volunteers & to Free and Cheap Things meetup groups.

ANY ONE INCLUDING MEETUP EVENT HOSTS, ASSISTANT ORGANIZERS, OR ORGANIZERS ARE ENCOURAGED to attend, exchange ideas or offer advice!

You may arrive as early as 6 PM, to MEETUP! YES FOOD or REFRESHMENT are allowed, so bring your own!  We'll socialize at the "Reception". The actual event begins at 6:30. It is informal, not a "lecture"! After 8 PM we can linger to chat if you want.

THIS EVENT IS FREE.

DID YOU KNOW ANYONE can create & host a meetup!? As Assistant Organizers you don't pay bills.

Your hosts are 2 professional teachers as well as very experienced Meetup.com Boston area organizers who have created & hosted 200 meetups each, successful meetups including Nerd Fun Snob events to Flash Mobs to pub crawls to Patriots Football to bike tours to language meetups to Happy Hour events & to music/ dance events. LEARN THE SECRETS.

We can tell you how to choose events that will draw the people in, popular venues, essential "must check in advance" info, what meetups are trendy, how to make the layout of your meetups appealing, how to promote your meetup, key common mistakes to avoid, & how to run/ facilitate your event.

We can also tell you how to become an Event Host or Assistant Organizer of meetups so you don't have to front paying the bills. Or if you do pay the bills, how to avoid wasting your money.

T stop= Red Line to Central Sq. & walk 2 blocks. Parking = Green St. Parking Garage.

Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: Go to the big Lewis conference room, 2nd floor
item.name: How Any one can Plan & Host a Successful Meetup for Free --Plus Refreshments
